text: Yannick Quentrec (born 17 February 1962 in Paris) is a French former sprinter who competed primarily in the 400 metres. He represented at the 1984 and 1992 Summer Olympics, as well as two World Championships. ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |1983 |World Championships |Helsinki, Finland |8th (sf) |4 × 400 m relay |3:05.09 |- |rowspan=2|1984 |rowspan=2|Olympic Games |rowspan=2|Los Angeles, United States |38th (h) |400 m |46.94 |- |17th (h) |4 × 400 m relay |3:08.33 |- |rowspan=3|1986 |European Indoor Championships |Madrid, Spain |17th (h) |200 m |23.09 |- |rowspan=2|European Championships |rowspan=2|Stuttgart, West Germany |9th (sf) |400 m |45.89 |- |8th |4 × 400 m relay |3:10.17 |- |rowspan=2|1987 |rowspan=2|World Championships |rowspan=2|Rome, Italy |35th (h) |400 m |46.78 |- |11th (sf) |4 × 400 m relay |3:03.41 |- |1992 |Olympic Games |Barcelona, Spain |11th (h) |4 × 400 m relay |3:04.25 |} ==Personal bests== Outdoor *200 metres – 20.96 (-0.6 m/s, Dijon 1986) *400 metres – 45.47 (Cologne 1986) Indoor *200 metres – 23.09 (Madrid 1986) ==References== *All-Athletics profile Category:1962 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Paris Category:French male sprinters Category:Olympic athletes of France Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1984 Summer Olympics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1992 Summer Olympics Category:World Athletics Championships athletes for France
title: Yann Quentrec
